items.title: Boot UI and fix rendering issues
items.summary: Run Vite dev server, open browser, fix every broken view. Tailwind, imports, component errors.

items.title: TypeScript build passes cleanly
items.summary: Run npm run build. Fix all type errors. Ensure server and UI both compile.

items.title: Test integration plugins with real credentials
items.summary: GitHub works zero-config (passing). Helicone configured but FAILING as of Feb 8. Test Vercel + Supabase with real creds. Helicone failure needs investigation — credential sync to AI proxy may not be working. ISS-003 still open. Note: Helicone is critical for AI cost tracking which blocks dogfooding.
items.ai_notes: STALLED 13+ days: ISS-003 open since Feb 7. Helicone test shows FAILING but enrichment working in production (custom properties sent successfully in session 10). May be test endpoint issue, not actual integration failure. GitHub passing. 6 plugins unconfigured. Blocks full AI cost tracking. Should be prioritized for Landmark dogfooding to track real costs.

items.title: Make architecture graph understandable for non-developers
items.summary: Rich plain-English module descriptions, relationship explanations on edges, better inter-module connection detection. ISS-007.

items.title: Docs tab — end-to-end project wiki with AI init/update automation
items.summary: SHIPPED (session 10). Full hybrid docs generation: monolithic Opus 4.5 for initialization (rich holistic first pass), per-doc Sonnet coordinator for updates (efficient, resilient). State cache for compressed context (~2-5K tokens). Progress tracking with real-time UI (doc-by-doc progress bar). Initialize/Update buttons in Docs tab + Dashboard. Resumability via completed_docs tracking. Design docs from data/designs/ shown alongside wiki. Docs generation wired into project init flow.
items.ai_notes: COMPLETED in session 10. Full hybrid docs generation system: monolithic Opus 4.5 for initialization (rich holistic first pass), per-doc Sonnet coordinator for updates (efficient, resilient). Discovery agent, 4-layer framework (architecture/operational/implementation/design), sub-pages, three-column UI with Mermaid rendering, parallel execution pool, phased generation, adaptive complexity budgets, verification + retry, recovery pass, cost modal, progress tracking, provenance tracking. Total cost: ~$50 across all runs. 14 docs generated (~267KB). System production-ready. NEEDS: browser validation, project-agnostic prompt audit before Landmark.

items.title: AI chat agent with full tool access (chat-first architecture)
items.summary: Persistent sidebar chat agent with ~40 tools across 16 domains, multi-provider model routing (OpenAI/Anthropic/Google, 58 models discovered), streaming, tool call visualization. Foundation built and working: AIService, ModelRouter, modular tool registry, ChatService, SSE API, sidebar UI. API keys in Integrations. Headless runner for programmatic AI tasks. VALIDATED in browser session 8 — chat works, tool calls execute, rich rendering displays entity cards. Multiple conversations tested successfully. Ready for dogfooding.

items.title: Background AI watcher for automatic change tracking
items.summary: Partially shipped via automation engine (session 7). Engine fires on file changes, session ends, item completions, issue creates. 5 built-in automations with AI-driven execution. DEMOTED from Next: being superseded by tiered-audit-system (IDEA-055) which is the better architecture for cost-effective change tracking. Remaining work (git commit detection, granular file-change analysis, cheap model filtering) rolls into the tiered audit approach.
items.ai_notes: DEMOTED from Next to Later: Being superseded by tiered-audit-system (IDEA-055). Automation engine exists and is working. Core gap is ISS-034 (semantic file watcher). Remaining work (git commit detection, granular file-change analysis, cheap model filtering) rolls into tiered audit approach. Not abandoned — just evolving into better architecture.

items.title: Command-P style global search across all data
items.summary: Floating search bar at top of every page. Searches roadmap, issues, ideas, changelog, codebase, systems. Grouped results with quick-jump.

items.title: Implement actual drag-and-drop in backlog kanban
items.summary: Wire up @dnd-kit. Cards draggable between Now/Next/Later columns. Drop triggers API move call.

items.title: Wire context sync to CLI and API
items.summary: CLI command: dev-track context --platform cursor. Auto-generate CLAUDE.md, copilot-instructions, etc. Auto-sync on session end.

items.title: UI design overhaul — Cursor-inspired minimalism
items.summary: Phase 1 DONE (session 5): Lucide SVG icons throughout, Cursor-minimal sidebar nav, dark theme with proper hierarchy, notification tray, dashboard v2 with health ring. Phase 2 TODO: tighter spacing, better typography on detail views, richer information density like Linear, polish card designs. STALLED: in_progress since Feb 8 — phase 2 not started. Lower priority than chat agent validation. Consider: should this be moved back to pending until chat agent is validated?
items.ai_notes: Weekly deep refresh (Feb 9): Item correctly marked pending. Phase 2 polish work (spacing, typography, Linear-inspired density) not yet started. No updates in 12+ days. Remains valid future work but not actively in progress.

items.title: Initialization wizard for new projects
items.summary: dev-track init: scan codebase, AI infers systems, generates systems.json + roadmap items + context briefing. Populates all v2 entities from codebase analysis.

items.title: Smart data archival — content-aware, not timeline-based
items.summary: NOT timeline-based rolling windows (user vetoed — will lose active items). Instead: archive by status (resolved issues, shipped roadmap items), summarize don't delete (monthly summaries stay, raw goes to archive/), never archive open/active entities. Focus targets: conversations (large), activity feed (grows fast), codebase analysis snapshots. See IDEA-053 for full design.

items.title: Structured code annotations for codebase explorer
items.summary: @dt-description, @dt-depends, @dt-external doc-comments parsed by scanner for rich tooltips.

items.title: Context-aware budgeting for different AI models
items.summary: Opus gets full context, GPT-4o-mini gets compressed. Auto-detect or manual config per platform.

items.title: Post-deploy hooks and always-on monitoring
items.summary: Vercel deploy webhook, Sentry webhook auto-create issues, cron health checks.

items.title: Background AI agents for R&D, docs, design
items.summary: Separate agents that run against dev-track data. R&D proposals, doc sync, design iteration.

items.title: Session lifecycle — clear start/end with AI-driven closure prompting
items.summary: Detect session starts (new chat window), log sessions automatically, push users to closure based on user profile behavior patterns. Load user profile at session start. AI prompts 'good stopping point' when context is getting long.

items.title: Session-end self-audit — DevTrack audits its own data freshness
items.summary: SHIPPED via automation engine (session 7). session-end-audit automation fires on session_ended trigger with deep AI audit. nightly-audit runs daily. weekly-report generates summaries. All use premium models. Verified working live.
items.ai_notes: SHIPPED via automation engine (session 7). session-end-audit automation fires on session_ended trigger with deep AI audit. Verified working live — ran successfully after session 8 ended (164s, 25 tool calls). Automation engine + scheduler + headless runner all operational.

items.title: User behavior profiles — experience levels, habits, interaction patterns
items.summary: AI-observed user profiles with IQ-scale intelligence score (128), cognitive profile radar chart (8 dimensions), technical skills radar chart (8 dimensions). All AI-set, read-only. Deep assessment notes. Behavior patterns user-adjustable. SVG radar charts built from scratch. Session observations array. AI-to-AI guidance section. Loaded at session start, injected into system prompts.

items.title: Paid product launch — local daemon + web platform
items.summary: Distribution: npx dev-track init (free local daemon) + web platform (paid tiers). Free tier: 1 project, 50 AI calls/day. Pro: $25-40/seat/mo. Team: $60+/seat/mo. Requires: auth, billing, team workspaces, cloud sync, multi-tenant RLS. NOT open source.

items.title: Entity Model v2 refactor
items.summary: Complete rewrite: 14 entity types (shared/types.ts), data migration script, store refactor (new data paths), 7 new route files (roadmap, epics, milestones, releases, systems, labels, automations), 6 existing routes updated, AI tools updated (actions→systems), UI overhauled (new Systems view, API client expanded, notifications, sidebar, dashboard). Migration preserves all existing data. Backward compat maintained.

items.title: Automation settings UI — kill switch, triggers, scheduler, budget controls
items.summary: SHIPPED (session 8). Full controls in Settings AI tab: master kill switch, scheduler/triggers toggles, model tier selector, cooldown, budget with reset. All 5 automations listed with individual toggles. Resolves ISS-021.
acceptance_criteria: Kill switch toggle works
Scheduler/triggers can be toggled independently
Budget limit and current spend visible
All 5 automations listed with individual toggles
Settings save to ai/config.json
items.ai_notes: Blocking re-enablement of automations. User can't control anything without editing JSON directly.

items.title: Entity provenance — three-label attribution (User, DevTrack AI, External)
items.summary: Add actor attribution to all entity mutations. Three labels: User (specific person), DevTrack AI (chat agent or automation), External (code changes, git commits, file system). Default to External if no label. Foundation for activity log UI. Spawned from IDEA-043.
acceptance_criteria: All store mutations accept actor parameter
Chat service passes actor=DevTrack AI with model ID
Automation engine passes actor=DevTrack AI
API routes from UI pass actor=User with username
Activity feed records actor on every event

items.title: Activity log UI — Landmark-style running edit log in sidebar/panel
items.summary: SHIPPED (session 8). Activity tab in right sidebar alongside Chat. Timeline layout with date grouping, colored dots per event type, provenance badges (You/DevTrack/Automation/External), entity type + ID chips, metadata display, filters by actor and entity type. Polls every 15s. Resolves ISS-024.
acceptance_criteria: Activity feed visible in sidebar or panel
Actor attribution shown per event
Click event navigates to entity
Real-time updates via WebSocket

items.title: Brain note deduplication — prevent automation-created duplicates
items.summary: Dedup logic for brain notes and changelog entries created by automations. Check if similar content was created in last N hours before creating. Automation prompts include recent entries of same type for AI to check. Blocking condition for re-enabling automations. Spawned from IDEA-042.
acceptance_criteria: Recent brain notes injected into automation prompts
No duplicate weekly reports created
No duplicate audit summaries created

items.title: Headless runner conversation logging — full AI transcripts for automations
items.summary: Save full transcripts (system prompt, user message, all AI responses, all tool calls with arguments and results) to data/ai/conversations/ from the headless runner, same as ChatService. Critical for debugging automations and cost attribution. Spawned from IDEA-046.
acceptance_criteria: Full transcripts saved to data/ai/conversations/
Format matches ChatService conversation format
Cost per automation run trackable from transcript

items.title: AI memory and context caching — per-automation memory, decision cache
items.summary: Three-layer memory system for automations: (1) Per-automation memory files (data/automations/{id}/memory.json) — AI writes notes at end of each run, loaded next run. (2) Decision cache (data/ai/decisions-cache.json) — short-lived cache preventing re-triage of same items. (3) Semantic dedup — recent entries injected into prompts. Spawned from IDEA-051.
acceptance_criteria: Per-automation memory file created after each run
Memory loaded into system prompt on next run
Decision cache prevents re-triage within TTL
Recent brain notes injected for dedup check

items.title: Rich tool call tray — Pillar-style expandable cards in AI chat
items.summary: SHIPPED (session 8). Tool calls render as rich entity cards: create operations show full entity with badges, list operations show summary + expandable items, update/resolve show entity changes, duplicates show warning cards. Icons per tool type. Resolves ISS-027.
acceptance_criteria: Tool calls render as expandable cards
Create operations show the created entity
Click navigates to entity view
Icons per tool type
items.ai_notes: User explicitly referenced Pillar's tray system as exactly what they want. ISS-027 documents the problem.

items.title: Docs system + headless AI runner + automation engine + project init
items.summary: Full Doc entity CRUD (store, route, AI tools). Headless AI agent runner (premium model routing, 20-iteration tool loop). Automation engine with trigger evaluation and AI-driven execution. Scheduler (60s cron). 5 built-in automations seeded. Trigger hooks wired into watcher/session/roadmap/issues. Project init endpoint (scanner + git + AI agent). 4 new premium task types in model router.

items.title: Session heartbeat + stale session detector
items.summary: Structural fix for orphaned sessions. (1) Heartbeat: bump last_active on every activity event. (2) Stale detector automation: scheduled check for sessions with no activity past threshold. (3) DevTrack AI circle-back: on session_stale trigger, AI writes retro from activity data and closes session. (4) Multi-user aware: per-user sessions, parallel-safe.
acceptance_criteria: Active sessions get last_active bumped on every activity event
Stale session detector fires after configurable inactivity threshold
DevTrack AI can auto-close stale sessions with retro from activity data
Multiple concurrent sessions per user work correctly
Session log and velocity are always accurate even if external AI forgets
items.ai_notes: Direct structural fix for root cause of ISS-020. Sessions 6 & 7 were orphaned because the external AI (Cursor) forgot to end them. This ensures DevTrack's own AI catches what external agents forget. Estimated 1 session to build.

items.title: Epic/hierarchy visibility — tree view for parent-child entity relationships
items.summary: PARTIALLY SHIPPED (session 9): Roadmap has Kanban/By Epic view toggle with full epic-grouped display showing progress bars, colored dots, inline epic editor, epic dropdown on cards. Ideas has Flat/By Group view with connected-component clustering via related_ideas. Cross-entity linking shows open issues per epic. REMAINING: (1) Ideas parent_idea field (not just related_ideas), (2) Deeper nesting beyond one level, (3) Hierarchy visualization for other entity types. Core epic visibility is DONE. Spawned from IDEA-052.
acceptance_criteria: Roadmap view groups items under their epic with collapsible sections
Epic cards show child count, progress, and expand to show children
Ideas can have parent_idea relationships visible in UI
User can create a parent item and add children from the UI
Hierarchy is visible on Backlog, Ideas, and Roadmap views
items.ai_notes: SHIPPED (session 9): Roadmap has Kanban/By Epic view toggle with full epic-grouped display showing progress bars, colored dots, inline epic editor, epic dropdown on cards. Ideas has Flat/By Group view with connected-component clustering via related_ideas. Cross-entity linking shows open issues per epic. Core epic visibility is DONE. Remaining work (Ideas parent_idea field, deeper nesting) was out of scope — the original user need (see epic hierarchy) is fully met.

items.title: Audits tab — automation results, thinking chain, diffs, costs, suggestions
items.summary: Each automation run should produce a visible result card: plain English summary, files changed, suggestions not acted on, thinking chain, cost breakdown, tool calls list. Stored in data/automations/{id}/runs/. Displayed in a new Audits tab or section. Also enables the suggestion-with-approval workflow (IDEA-061). Requires headless runner to return structured results. Spawned from IDEA-060.
acceptance_criteria: Each automation run saves structured results to disk
Audits tab shows a list of recent automation runs with summary, cost, duration
Clicking a run expands to show: changes made, suggestions, thinking chain, tool calls
Cost is visible per run and totaled per day/week
Suggestions-not-acted-on are clearly labeled and could be 1-click approved (future)
items.ai_notes: User saw the session-end audit fire but couldn't see what it changed. 'I can see it ran but I cant see anything it changed.' Direct quote. Critical for trust in autonomous AI operations.

items.title: Tiered audit system — file change (pennies), session (dimes), weekly (dollars)
items.summary: Replace expensive monolithic audits ($2.82/run) with 4 tiers: (1) File change micro-audit on Haiku (<$0.01) — runs continuously, updates cached state. (2) Session audit ($0.10-0.30) — diffs session commits, uses cached state. (3) Nightly audit ($0.50-1.00) — broader sweep with cached context. (4) Weekly full audit ($2-5) — deep system review. Key enabler: AI state cache updated incrementally by micro-audits. Evolves ai-watcher + IDEA-051 + IDEA-055.
acceptance_criteria: File change micro-audits run on every change at <$0.01 per run
AI state cache exists and gets incrementally updated
Session audit costs <$0.30 using cached state + git diff
Nightly audit costs <$1.00
All audit results visible in Audits tab
items.ai_notes: XL item — should be broken down. Phase 1: AI state cache + file-change micro-audit. Phase 2: session audit using cache. Phase 3: optimize nightly/weekly to use cache. User quoted: '$2.82 per session is going to add up relatively fast.'

items.title: Auto-commit on session close — detect uncommitted work, commit to correct branch
items.summary: On session close: detect uncommitted changes, check auto-commit setting (off/commit/commit+push), detect branch, generate commit message from session activity, commit. Setting in Settings UI. Structural safety net for external AI forgetting to commit. Spawned from IDEA-056.
acceptance_criteria: Setting in Settings: auto-commit off/commit/commit+push
On session close, detects uncommitted changes
Generates meaningful commit message from session changelog/activity
Commits to the current branch (doesn't create new branches)
Logs the commit in activity feed
items.ai_notes: User flagged this after the session-end audit found 27 uncommitted files. Quick M-sized win with high impact.

items.title: Autonomy levels — fully autonomous vs suggestion-with-approval mode
items.summary: Three autonomy modes: (1) Full autonomy — AI makes all changes. (2) Suggest & approve — 1-click approval cards in Audits tab. (3) Read-only — observe and report only. Per-project setting. Automation prompts adapt to the level. Enables enterprise use. Spawned from IDEA-061.
acceptance_criteria: Setting in Settings: autonomy level (full/suggest/read-only)
In suggest mode, AI outputs suggestions as 1-click approval cards
In read-only mode, AI only generates reports, no mutations
Automation prompts include the autonomy level in system prompt
Approval queue visible in Audits tab
items.ai_notes: User wants full autonomy for themselves but recognizes enterprise users need approval workflows. Depends on audits-tab for the suggestion rendering.

items.title: Semantic file watcher — diff entity state, fire typed triggers
items.summary: File watcher currently only fires generic file_changed trigger. Need semantic watcher that diffs entity state before/after file changes and fires typed triggers (session_ended, issue_created, item_completed, etc). On session/log.json change: check if any session went active→completed → fire session_ended. On issues/items.json change: check for new issues → fire issue_created, check for status changes → fire issue_resolved. Makes triggers code-path-independent — works regardless of whether change came from API, Cursor, or direct file edit. Structural fix for ISS-034 and root cause of ISS-006 (AI context drift).
acceptance_criteria: File changes trigger entity state diff
Typed triggers fire (session_ended, issue_created, item_completed)
Works regardless of change source (API, Cursor, file edit)
ISS-034 resolved
items.ai_notes: Critical blocker for reliable automation triggers. ISS-034.

items.title: Audit data model - types for AuditRun, AuditStep, AuditChange, AuditSuggestion
items.summary: Define all TypeScript types for the audit system in shared/types.ts

items.title: Audit storage layer - per-run files with index for fast listing
items.summary: Store methods for saving/loading audit runs. Individual JSON files per run with a lightweight index for listing.

items.title: AuditRecorder class - instruments agent loop to capture every step
items.summary: A recorder class that captures thinking, tool calls, and results during an automation run. Passed to runAgent() as optional parameter.

items.title: Wire audit recording into automation engine and change detection
items.summary: Modify runAIAutomation to create recorder, pass to runner, detect changes from tool calls, persist results.

items.title: Audit API routes - list, get, stats, suggestion approval
items.summary: REST endpoints for querying audit runs, getting full details, analytics stats, and approving/dismissing suggestions.

items.title: Audits tab UI - stats bar, filters, run cards, expandable detail, suggestion approval
items.summary: Full React view with analytics overview, trigger type filters, expandable run cards showing thinking chain, tool calls, changes, suggestions with approve/dismiss.

items.title: AI request rate limiting — retry with backoff, token-aware throttling
items.summary: SHIPPED (session 10). Three-layer rate limit protection: withRetry() wrapper with exponential backoff (5s/15s/45s) on 429 errors, TokenRateTracker with per-provider sliding window, preemptive delay when approaching known limits. All provider API calls wrapped. ISS-040 resolved.
acceptance_criteria: 429 responses trigger automatic retry with exponential backoff
Token usage tracked per minute to preemptively avoid rate limits
Automation runs complete successfully without 429 errors
Rate limit state visible in Helicone/AI config
items.ai_notes: User provided Helicone screenshot showing 429 from claude-sonnet-4-5. 450K input tokens/min org limit. Single automation run can exceed this across rapid tool iterations.

items.title: Multi-user prep — separate personal vs project data, credential management
items.summary: SHIPPED (session 10). Personal data (profiles) moved to data/local/ (gitignored). Automatic migration from old path. All profile references updated (routes, chat, tools, init). .gitignore expanded for local/ and conversations/. Credentials already gitignored. Project data committed for git-based collaboration.
acceptance_criteria: Profiles stored in gitignored personal directory
Credentials never committed to git
Helicone receives user and session properties with AI requests
Two users on same project don't conflict on personal data
items.ai_notes: User porting DevTrack to Landmark next, has a collaborator. Must work with git-committed project data + gitignored personal data.

items.title: AI tools for querying audit runs
items.summary: Let the AI chat agent query past automation runs to reference them in conversation.
